diseases.name: Tomato Blight
diseases.description: A common fungal disease affecting tomato plants, causing leaf spots and fruit rot.
diseases.recommendation: Remove and destroy infected plants. Apply copper-based fungicides. Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.description: Fungal disease that forms a white powdery coating on leaves and stems.
diseases.recommendation: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate-based fungicides. Remove affected leaves. Improve air circulation.

diseases.name: Leaf Spot
diseases.description: Fungal or bacterial disease causing circular spots on leaves.
diseases.recommendation: Remove infected leaves. Apply appropriate fungicide. Avoid overhead watering.

diseases.name: Aphid Infestation
diseases.description: Small insects that suck sap from plants, causing distorted growth.
diseases.recommendation: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil. Introduce natural predators like ladybugs.

diseases.name: Root Rot
diseases.description: Fungal disease that affects the roots, often due to overwatering.
diseases.recommendation: Improve soil drainage. Reduce watering. Apply fungicide if caught early.
